choices.B: The ADR base keeps all diagnostic information in binary format.
choices.D: The ADR can be used for problem diagnosis even when the database instance is down.
choices.A: The ADR base is shared across multiple instances.
choices.E: The ADR is used to store Automatic Workload Repository (AWR) snapshots.
choices.C: The ADR can be used to store statspack snapshots to diagnose database performance issues.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about the Automatic Diagnostic Repository (ADR)?

choices.A: A common user connected to a pluggable database (PDB) can exercise privileges across other PDBs.
choices.D: A common user can have a local schema in a PDB.
choices.B: A common user with the create user privilege can create other common users, as well as local users.
choices.E: A common user always uses the global temporary tablespace that is defined at the CDB level as the default temporary tablespace.
choices.C: A common user can be granted only a common role.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about a common user?

choices.C: The duplicate database is created by using the backups created during the execution of
choices.B: The duplicate database has the same directory structure as the source database.
choices.F: The duplicate database is created without using RMAN backups and prod: is allowed to remain open during duplication.
choices.A: All archive redo log files are automatically copied to the duplicate database.
choices.E: The password file and SPFILE for the duplicate database dup1 are created in their respective default locations.

discussion.content:
B and E are correct.
D is not correct at all, because the Password File and SPFILE are copied from source database and places on default locations on target database, but just talks about "created" does not references to copied from...

questions.question_text:
RMAN is connected to the target database prod1 and an auxiliary instance in nomount state. Examine the command to create a duplicate database:
RMAN> DUPLICATE TARGET DATABASE TO dup1

FROM ACTIVE DATABASE -

NOFILENAMECHECK -

PASSWORD FILE -
SPFILE;
Which two statements are true about the execution of the duplicate command?

choices.A: Drop the tenpOi.dbf file, and then re-create the temp file.
choices.C: Shut down the database instance, start up the database instance in mount state, create a new temporary tablespace, and then open the database.
choices.B: Add a new temp file to the temporary tablespace and drop the tempOi.dbf file.
choices.E: Create a new temporary tablespace and assign it as the default to the user.
choices.D: Take the temporary tablespace offline, recover the missing temp file, and then bring the temporary tablespace online.

questions.question_text:
A user issues a query on the sales table and receives the following error:
ERROR at line 1:
ORA-01565: error in identifying file '/u0l/app/oracle/oradata/ORCL/temp01.dbf'
ORA-27037: unable to obtain file status
Which two actions would you take to recover the temporary tablespace?

Your database supports an online transaction processing (OLTP) workload in which one of the applications creates a temporary table for a session and performs transactions on it. This consumes a lot of undo tablespace and is affecting undo retention.
Which two actions would you take to solve this problem?

choices.A: Enable temporary undo for the database.
choices.E: Increase the size of the temporary tablespace.
choices.C: Increase the size of the redo log buffer.
